  2. /*
  3. * Copyright (C) Igor Sysoev
  4. * Copyright (C) Nginx, Inc.
  5. */


  8. #if (NGX_SMP)
  9. ‌#define NGX_SMP_LOCK  "lock;"
  10. #else
  11. ‌#define NGX_SMP_LOCK
  12. #endif


  15. /*
  16. * "cmpxchgq  r, [m]":
  17. *
  18. *     if (rax == [m]) {
  19. *         zf = 1;
  20. *         [m] = r;
  21. *     } else {
  22. *         zf = 0;
  23. *         rax = [m];
  24. *     }
  25. *
  26. *
  27. * The "r" is any register, %rax (%r0) - %r16.
  28. * The "=a" and "a" are the %rax register.
  29. * Although we can return result in any register, we use "a" because it is
  30. * used in cmpxchgq anyway.  The result is actually in %al but not in $rax,
  31. * however as the code is inlined gcc can test %al as well as %rax.
  32. *
  33. * The "cc" means that flags were changed.
  34. */

  36. static ngx_inline ngx_atomic_uint_t
  37. ‌ngx_atomic_cmp_set(ngx_atomic_t *lock, ngx_atomic_uint_t old,
  38.     ngx_atomic_uint_t set)
  39. {
  40.     u_char  res;

  42.     __asm__ volatile (

  44.          NGX_SMP_LOCK
  45.     "    cmpxchgq  %3, %1;   "
  46.     "    sete      %0;       "

  48.     : "=a" (res) : "m" (*lock), "a" (old), "r" (set) : "cc", "memory");

  50.     return res;
  51. }


  54. /*
  55. * "xaddq  r, [m]":
  56. *
  57. *     temp = [m];
  58. *     [m] += r;
  59. *     r = temp;
  60. *
  61. *
  62. * The "+r" is any register, %rax (%r0) - %r16.
  63. * The "cc" means that flags were changed.
  64. */

  66. static ngx_inline ngx_atomic_int_t
  67. ‌ngx_atomic_fetch_add(ngx_atomic_t *value, ngx_atomic_int_t add)
  68. {
  69.     __asm__ volatile (

  71.          NGX_SMP_LOCK
  72.     "    xaddq  %0, %1;   "

  74.     : "+r" (add) : "m" (*value) : "cc", "memory");

  76.     return add;
  77. }


  80. ‌#define ngx_memory_barrier()    __asm__ volatile ("" ::: "memory")

  82. ‌#define ngx_cpu_pause()         __asm__ ("pause")
